RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 7F Dirt CR: 64. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MOSES WATER went to the front to set a pressured pace, was challenged around the final turn and down the stretch but dug in and held off the outside challenge to prove best. NET WORTH raced near the back around the first turn then moved up from between horses going into the final turn then engaged the leader and dueled down the stretch to be a game second. MUD BUG was unhurried down the backstretch, made a five wide bid at the five sixteenths pole to rally but was not enough. MY SLICK NICK was within striking distance while saving ground and finished evenly. CAN'T STOP MAXEY hit the gate when leaving and broke outward then was hustled forward but went four wide around the first turn and down the backstretch and weakened on the final turn. CHASING STORMS was off the pace from three wide to the quarter pole and gave way. SPEIGHTY SENSE prompted the pace from the two path down the backstretch then was steadied around the three furlong pole, fell back and never regained action.

ENTRY.NAME: Moses Water
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, challenged, dug in, held on

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Country Life Farm & Union Waters LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Speighty Sense
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompt pace, steadied

ENTRY.NAME: Mud Bug
ENTRY.OWNER: Prostar 10 Stables Inc and The Four Horsemen Racing Stable Inc
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, 5w5/16p, rallied, not enuf

ENTRY.NAME: My Slick Nick
ENTRY.COMMENT: striking distance, saved ground, evenly

ENTRY.NAME: Chasing Storms
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 3 wide, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Net Worth
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, moved up, between horses, stretch duel, game 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Can't Stop Maxey
ENTRY.OWNER: A P Stable and Fox Tale Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: hit gate, broke out, 4 wide, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 14100. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE NOVEMBER 25, 2022. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 25 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Ra ces Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GARY DOING BIZ tracked the leader through the turn then slipped through at the eighth pole and drew clear. MAKE IT A DOUBLE had no early speed but made a rail bid on the turn to prove second best. DON'T EATTHE APPLE was off the pace on the backstretch then moved between horsed on the turn then moved out to three or four wide in the stretch to be a game third. SAFE REEZAN was hustled to the lead around the turn then was collared by inside rival at the eighth pole and tired. SOCIAL EXCLUSION was close up early but never made a bid. SCARLET TANAGER had good early speed then weakened. LADY LICIOUS had no speed and was never a threat. STYLISH PAINT had brief foot and retreated.

ENTRY.NAME: Gary Doing Biz
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leader, slipped through 1/8p, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Safe Reezan
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled to lead, collared 1/8p, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Make It a Double
ENTRY.COMMENT: no early speed, rail bid turn, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Don't Eatthe Apple
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, between horses, 3-4w stretch, game 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Social Exclusion
ENTRY.COMMENT: close up early, no bid

ENTRY.NAME: Scarlet Tanager
ENTRY.COMMENT: early speed, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Licious
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Stylish Paint
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief foot, retreated

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 59. Maiden Claiming Purse 18500. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAMA'S EYES prompted the pace down the backstretch then shared command around the turn, took over at the top of the stretch and drew off. KELSEY'S ANGEL was off the pace on the inside around the turn then angled out to the two path in the stretch and was a game second. SEAP sprinted to the lead on the backstretch then shared command around the turn and tired in the stretch but couldn't hold the place. MADI'S TUNE raced near the back early then move up from two wide on the turn and tipped out to three wide in upper stretch to improve her position. HEARD saved ground to no avail. TALENTED CORINNA tracked the leader early from the two path through the turn and retreated. PARISIAN SUMMER had no speed and was never a threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Seap
ENTRY.COMMENT: sprint to lead, shared command turn, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Parisian Summer
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Kelsey's Angel
ENTRY.OWNER: Burnsworth Richard and Metropolitan Thoroughbreds LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace inside, game 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Heard
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, no avail

ENTRY.NAME: Madi's Tune
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, 2w turn, 3w upper, improved position

ENTRY.NAME: Mama's Eyes
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace, shared command turn, drew off

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Dr. & Mrs. Thomas Bowman & Dr. BrookeBowman

ENTRY.NAME: Talented Corinna
ENTRY.OWNER: Campbell Kim and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leaders early, retreated

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 77. Allowance Purse 31600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 25 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 25 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $1 5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROAD PARTY went to an unchallenged lead and inched away on the final turn to prove much the best. LOGSTRADAMUS raced near the back to the first turn then moved between horse at the half pole to press the pace but was no match for the winner. HAZEDNCONFUSED was unhurried around the first turn then moved between horses around the three eighths pole then saved ground around the final turn and flattened out. NO LOVE FOR JUBA raced near the back around the first turn then made a mild four wide bid on the backstretch and finished evenly. REATA'S CASTLE was hustled early to be forwardly placed to the three eighths pole and faded. BLUE N GOLD remained back. ACASHA'S INTUITION tracked the leaders from the inside to the three furlong pole then took a bad step, was pulled up and vanned off.

ENTRY.NAME: Blue N Gold
ENTRY.OWNER: Funkhouser III, Raymond J. and Funkhouser, John C.
ENTRY.COMMENT: remained back

ENTRY.NAME: Acasha's Intuition
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, bad step, pulled up, vanned off

ENTRY.NAME: Road Party
ENTRY.COMMENT: unchallenged lead, inched away, much the best

ENTRY.NAME: Hazednconfused
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, between 3/8p, inside final turn, flattened out

ENTRY.NAME: No Love for Juba
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, mild 4w bid, finished evenly

ENTRY.NAME: Logstradamus
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, between horses 1/2p, pressed pace, no match

ENTRY.NAME: Reata's Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled early, forwardly placed, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 33. Maiden Claiming Purse 14400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHOWTHEMONEYHONEY was hustled away from the gate to be off the pace through the turn then moved to challenge the leader and was forced out in upper stretch but kept on and drew clear. BOWMANS LAZY GIRL was away alertly to have the speed through the turn then floated out to mid track but couldn't fend off the outside rival but held the place. LOCKDOWN VANNA raced in the middle of the pack around the turn then made a two wide bid in upper stretch and gave a late surged but missed the place. PRETTY CASTLE raced near the back to the turn then went three wide in upper stretch to make a late bid to improve position. S S CASINO GIRL had good early speed then tracked the leaders through the turn but was out finished. BELIEVE I CAN saved ground then moved up the rail into the stretch but was empty. OK EMILY was not a threat. JADE SKYE had no speed and was never a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Ok Emily
ENTRY.COMMENT: no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Pretty Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, 3w upper, late bid, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Jade Skye
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Believe I Can
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, rail bid, empty

ENTRY.NAME: Showthemoneyhoney
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled away, off pace, challenged upper, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Lockdown Vanna
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 2w upper, late surge, missed place

ENTRY.NAME: S S Casino Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: good early speed, tracked leaders, out finished

ENTRY.NAME: Bowmans Lazy Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, speed, floated out upper, couldn't fend, held 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 75. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 21800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE MAY 25, 2021 OR CLAIMING PRICE $10,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 25 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 25 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000 (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MISS WAVE tracked the leaders from the three path then moved up to vie for the lead down the backstretch then took over at the quarter pole and drew off. GRACE ELIZABETH was off the pace while saving ground moved up from two wide on the backstretch and made a late bid to be second best. SECRET CASTLE was hustled along to share the command to the first turn then pressed the pace around the first turn and took the lead at the half pole then was headed at the quarter pole and weakened. CASTLE OF CAYLEE was allowed to settle around the first turn then launched a three wide bid around the seven sixteenths pole and improved position late. ARROWWOOD raced in the middle of the pack then went three on the turn while racing evenly. HOW IS SHE was unhurried around the first turn and down the backstretch then made a mild bid on the final turn but was not a threat. MOIRAINE failed to menace. GOT YOUR NUMBER shared command to the first turn then took a brief lead and was through early. MISS LAUREN reared as the gates opened and lost rider. A STEWARDS INQUIRY WAS POSTED INTO THE START OF THE RACE FOR MISS LAUREN AFTER A STEWARDS REVIEW, IT WAS DETERMINED THAT MISS LAUREN WAS THE CAUSE OF HER OWN PROBLEMS AND NO ACTION WAS TAKEN.

ENTRY.NAME: Got Your Number
ENTRY.COMMENT: share command, brief lead, through early

ENTRY.NAME: Grace Elizabeth
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, saved ground, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Castle of Caylee
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 3w bid 7/16p, improved position

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Wave
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leaders, vied for lead, took over 1/4p, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Lauren
ENTRY.COMMENT: reared start, lost rider

ENTRY.NAME: Arrowwood
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, 3w turn, evenly

ENTRY.NAME: Moiraine
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace

ENTRY.NAME: How Is She
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, mild bid turn, no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Secret Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled along, shared command, led 1/2p, headed 1/4p, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Allowance Purse 30500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 25 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 25 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Whe re Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STRONG WILLED tracked the leader to the final turn then engaged at the quarter pole and matched strides through the stretch and cleared late. LOVE OF GRACE was allowed to settle to the final turn then made a four wide bid for a late run and was up for the place. TRUE FLIRT went to an unchallenged lead to the top of the stretch then dueled to the final sixteenths and tired. SNEAKY LYNK broke in sharply at the start then raced in the middle of the pack around the first turn then made a rail bid but had to check slightly at the five sixteenths pole, made a rebid but was too late. LUCKY BOP stalked the pace from the two path around the final turn then angled out to four wide at the sixteenths pole but had no late bid. IHEARTRAINACOMN was off the pace on the inside to the quarter pole and faded. FRENCHIES GOLD was steadied at the start when forced in then remained back. AMELIA'S DREAM was off slow and was never a threat. PATTI BLUE EYES was steadied at the start when forced in then raced rank around the first turn but was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Iheartrainacomn
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Strong Willed
ENTRY.OWNER: Nikki Horses Racing and Fanelli John
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leader, engaged 1/4p, stretch duel, cleared late

ENTRY.NAME: Patti Blue Eyes
ENTRY.OWNER: Fanelli John Cash is King LLC and LC Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied start, rank early, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Frenchies Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied start, remained back

ENTRY.NAME: Sneaky Lynk
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in sharply, mid pack, rail bid, slight check, too late

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Bop
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, 4w 1/16p, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Love of Grace
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 4w 2nd turn, late run, up 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Amelia's Dream
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, no threat

ENTRY.NAME: True Flirt
ENTRY.OWNER: Rogers Louie and Lewis Jr William R
ENTRY.COMMENT: unchallenged lead, stretch duel, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 12000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 25 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SCOOTSCOOT was hustled to a clear lead around the first turn then inched away on the final turn and won going away. BUBBA G was away alertly then tracked the leader down the backstretch and made a mild bid on the final turn but was no match for the winner. BET ON BITZ raced in the middle of the pack down the backstretch then moved out to four wide in the stretch for a late bid and was up for the show. ADARA was forwardly placed on the inside and failed to menace. BARB'S PRIDE broke outward at the start then rushed up to prompt the pace down the backstretch and gave way. ANGELUS DIAMOND raced near the back and failed to menace. GORUN had no speed and passed tiring ones. CHERRYS CROSS saved ground to no avail. NOTIMELIKEPRESENT was off slow and race wide throughout and was never a threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Adara
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed, failed to menace

ENTRY.NAME: Bubba G
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked leader, mild bid, no match

ENTRY.NAME: Cherrys Cross
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, no avail

ENTRY.NAME: Bet On Bitz
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, 4w stretch, late bid, up show

ENTRY.NAME: Gorun
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, passed tiring ones

ENTRY.NAME: Scootscoot
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled to lead, going away

ENTRY.NAME: Angelus Diamond
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, no menace

ENTRY.NAME: Barb's Pride
ENTRY.OWNER: P and H Stables and C and B Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke outward, rushed up, prompt pace, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Notimelikepresent
ENTRY.OWNER: Bone Robert D and Brown Jr Edward J
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, wide trip, no threat
